Question: Android view enum: :In Android I want to make a enum with views (let's say with EditTexts).I thought to initialize an EditText with findViewById(R.id.something), you have to do that in a activity-class or you need a instance of this class.So how can I initialize the EditTexts in a enum or can I set the Views from the main-class?I thought about something like this, but it won't work:enum Edits {    one(/* what to write here */), two(/* what to write here */);    private EditText editText;    Edits(EditText editText){        this.editText = editText;    }    EditText getEditText(){        return this.editText;    }    void setEditText(EditText editText){ // Maybe something like this?        this.editText = editText;    }}So, how would you do that?

Answer:
You can't initialize EditTexts in an enum because enums are a special type of class in Java that represents a group of constants. They are used to declare a type that can have a certain set of predefined constants. You can't instantiate them. Instead, you can use a class or a static field to hold the EditTexts.

You can initialize EditTexts in your activity class and then assign them to the enum values. Here is an example:

```java
public class MainActivity extends AppCompatActivity {
    enum Edits {
        one, two;
        private EditText editText;
    }

    @Override
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
        super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
        setContentView(R.layout.activity_main);

        EditText one = findViewById(R.id.one);
        EditText two = findViewById(R.id.two);

        Edits.one.setEditText(one);
        Edits.two.setEditText(two);
    }
}
```

In this example, the EditTexts with the id "one" and "two" are initialized in the onCreate() method of the MainActivity class. Then, the EditTexts are assigned to the enum values Edits.one and Edits.two.

Now, you can access the EditTexts in your enum values like this:

```java
EditText editText = Edits.one.getEditText();
```

This will return the EditText associated with the enum value Edits.one.

Please note that you need to replace `R.id.one` and `R.id.two` with the actual ids of your EditTexts in your layout file.
